text: Let's talk about the challenges in bundle creation for retailers and large e-commerce
speaker: Unknown

text: brands.

text: Bundling isn't just difficult, it's a multi-layered organizational and technical nightmare for
speaker: Unknown

text: most large retail organizations.

text: And here are some of the challenges.
speaker: Unknown

text: Most retailers and brands outsource their marketing to agencies and the agencies often
speaker: Unknown

text: don't have direct access to product data and have to go through multiple stakeholders just
speaker: Unknown

text: so that they can get basic information.
speaker: Unknown

text: The merchandising team, the marketing team, the agency, all of them rarely communicate
speaker: Unknown

text: with each other effectively, which creates bottlenecks in this bundling process.
speaker: Unknown

text: And this is even before we start talking about a technical complexity.
speaker: Unknown

text: The average retailer is running a patchwork of systems, legacy systems, PIM systems, separate
speaker: Unknown

text: e-commerce platforms and various other marketing tools.
speaker: Unknown

text: None of these systems interact easily with each other.
speaker: Unknown

text: Even when you have access to the product data, it is often incomplete, inconsistent or the
speaker: Unknown

text: SKUs might be missing critical attributes like descriptions and creating bundles manually
speaker: Unknown

text: requires clean and comprehensive data, which most retailers and brands might not have.

text: Creating and maintaining these bundles also requires dedicated merchandising resources
speaker: Unknown

text: for a catalog with a thousand products.

text: The possible bundle combinations could be in the hundreds and most retailers can't really
speaker: Unknown

text: justify allocating significant resources to doing what they perceive might be a nice to
speaker: Unknown

text: have feature with uncertain ROI.

text: And this is precisely where AI can transform the entire approach.

text: of the existing systems.

speaker: Unknown

text: So here is exactly how we build the bundle creator.
speaker: Unknown

text: First we take the entire product catalog and product by product, we pass in every item
speaker: Unknown

text: through GPT-4-0 to generate a complimentary product selection.
speaker: Unknown

text: For example, if a customer is looking at a coffee maker, the model identifies that that
speaker: Unknown

text: product might naturally go with coffee beans, filters, a grinder, etc.
speaker: Unknown

text: The model generates these recommendations based on context.
speaker: Unknown

text: If someone is buying a coffee maker, what are they trying to do?
speaker: Unknown

text: Make coffee.
speaker: Unknown

text: What else do they need to make coffee effectively?
speaker: Unknown

text: We ask these questions and we come up with a list of complimentary products.
speaker: Unknown

text: Once we have the initial recommendations, we need to match them with the actual products
speaker: Unknown

text: in the store's catalog.
speaker: Unknown

text: And this is where we used our own custom embedding model that we trained in one of our older
speaker: Unknown

text: videos.

text: You can find that on our site by just looking for retail embedding model IONIW.

text: If you Google that, you'll find it.

text: The model that we trained is twice more accurate than the standard pre-print embedding model.
speaker: Unknown

text: So we just use our own model to convert the AIS listed products into actual catalog products
speaker: Unknown

text: from the brand's catalog.
speaker: Unknown

text: And this helps us find the closest matches in the real inventory.

text: Step 3, with our matched product descriptions, we go back to the LLM, in this case GPT-4-0,
speaker: Unknown

text: to generate compelling product bundle name, description and marketing copy.

text: For example, instead of just grouping related coffee products, the AI might create a morning
speaker: Unknown

text: perfect coffee experience.

text: in what they offer to their customers.
